Key Match Events: Max Meyer recorded 18 swings and misses, second-most for him this season.
Meyer notched more whiffs with his changeup than his four-seamer (five vs. three) and allowed no hits among the five base knocks.
Meyer’s six strikeouts were his most since Aug. 1, which was five starts ago.
Meyer walked a season-high four batters, two of which came around to score.
The defense behind Meyer committed four errors for the first time in a game since Sept. 2, 2021.
Aaron Schunk hit his first career homer to left field, turning on Meyer’s mislocated fastball for a solo shot.
The Rockies opened the sixth with a single and a walk to chase Meyer at 96 pitches. Two inherited runners scored to skew his final line (five-plus innings, five runs, four earned runs).
Post-Match Reflections: Marlins manager Skip Schumaker commented on the game, stating that the walks and the defense were the reasons for the loss.
Schumaker noted that Meyer’s slider had a lot more swing and miss, and his fastball command was better in the first four innings.
Meyer acknowledged being frustrated with his inconsistent performance, noting that he is used to succeeding and believes he will be very dominant once he gains 100% confidence.
